children.name: American Prison Data Systems Privacy Policy*
American Prison Data Systems Privacy Policy*
*All Terms Used In this American Prison Data Systems, PBC (“
”) unless otherwise defined herein are as defined in the APDS Terms of Service (the “
”) to which this Privacy Policy is linked and which is incorporated herein by reference.

This Privacy Policy applies to all users of the services provided by APDS, which services may be used by individuals in restrictive custody (“Learners”), the administrators (“Administrators”) and staff (“Facility Personnel”) of the facility in which the Learners are held in custody (the “Facility”), family, friends and other individuals authorized to communicate with Learners (collectively, “Family”), law enforcement personnel (“Law Enforcement”), attorneys representing Learners (“Attorneys” and collectively with Learners, Administrators, Facility Personnel, Family, and Law Enforcement, the “Authorized Users”). Services include, without limitation, APDS’ hosted software platform, mobile and desktop applications, websites and related services (collectively, the “

”) and other digital content, software applications, technology services, hosted websites, and secure hardware solutions for correctional institutions known as the “APDS Technology Suite” (collectively, the “

Except for specifically designated functions of the Services which explicitly state that content is designated and approved by Authorities as “Private” or “Attorney-Client Privileged” and are graphically indicated as such in a manner acceptable to APDS and the relevant Authorities, all content, messages, emails, text, audio, video, or graphics transmitted through the Services (“Content”) is subject to review by the relevant Authorities, and may be rejected as inappropriate at the sole discretion of any relevant Authority or APDS
” shall mean the prison, jail, corrections, educational or other institution or other law enforcement or governmental authority or agency providing Users with access to the Services.

APDS does not guarantee transmission of any Content, even if you have paid APDS as consideration for transmitting Content to an individual whose internet use is restricted by the criminal justice system (a “Restricted Individual”) who has been approved to be registered as an authorized user of the Services (an “Authorized User”).

You acknowledge and agree that the Services may include communications from APDS including, but not limited to, administrative messages and service announcements. You enable these communications upon your registration for the Services, and you are not permitted to opt out of receiving them while you have a registered account on the Services. From time to time, we may send you special offers or other marketing communications about our services, or those of our partners. You may opt out of these messages.
Subject to and without limiting the generality of the foregoing, at APDS we respect the privacy of those that access the Services (“

”) and are committed to protecting it through our compliance with this Privacy Policy. To the extent your information will be held by APDS and not an applicable legal authority, we understand that we have a responsibility to protect and respect your privacy and look after your personal data. This Privacy Policy explains what personal data we collect.

This Privacy Policy has been developed with a view to compliance with laws regulating privacy upon those providing limited online services to Restricted Individuals incarcerated at a corrections facility, including emancipated minors and juveniles ages 13 through 17 years (“
”) and under correctional control with the consent of their applicable Authority (each an “

”) to use the Services and as permitted by law. We do not provide access to or market our Services to any minor under the age of 13, and as such we do not collect any Data (as defined below) of minors under the age of 13.

In order to use the Services subject to this Privacy Policy you must obtain approval and remain approved by the Applicable Authorities. If at any time, for any reason, you lose the approval of the Applicable Authority to communicate with a given Restricted Individual, APDS will sever your connection with that individual. If the approval was rescinded because of misuse of the Services, your User-generated Content (defined
) may be turned over to the Applicable Authorities for their determination whether it should be disclosed or deleted.

This policy describes the types of data , including but not limited to, Restricted Individual data, metadata and User Generated Content as well as all Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and other non-public information we may collect from you or that you may provide to us (“

”) when you use the Services including, but not limited to, your use of an Internet browser or Mobile Application to visit the APDS-hosted websites located at connectedcorrections.com, nationalcorrectionsradio.com, nationalcorrectionslibrary.com, nationalcorrectionsworks.com, apds-services.com, apds.works or a website designated by your Applicable Authority (the "
") and our practices for collecting, using, maintaining, protecting and disclosing that Data.
This policy applies to Data we collect:
• In e-mail, text and other electronic messages when you use our Services.;
In e-mail, text and other electronic messages when you use our Services.;

• When you use our Services for video communications, which may result in recordings that are retained by APDS’ platform and may be monitored by the Applicable Authority or law enforcement, unless the communications relate to attorney-client communications.

When you use our Services for video communications, which may result in recordings that are retained by APDS’ platform and may be monitored by the Applicable Authority or law enforcement, unless the communications relate to attorney-client communications.
• When you interact with any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS and any Data and applications on third-party websites and services.
When you interact with any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS and any Data and applications on third-party websites and services.
It does not apply to Data collected by:

• through any other means, including on any other website operated by a Facility under the control of an Applicable Authority or by APDS or any third party (including any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS); or

through any other means, including on any other website operated by a Facility under the control of an Applicable Authority or by APDS or any third party (including any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS); or

• any third party (including any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS), including through any application or content that may link to or be accessible from our Services or on the Website(s).

any third party (including any APDS authorized partner, affiliate or Applicable Authority under contract with APDS), including through any application or content that may link to or be accessible from our Services or on the Website(s).

Please read this Privacy Policy carefully to understand our policies and practices regarding your Data and how we will treat it. If you do not agree with our policies and practices, your choice is not to use our Services. By submitting a registered Authorized User Account, accessing any of our Services, you agree to this Privacy Policy. This Privacy Policy may change from time to time. APDS will not change how Data is collected, used, or shared under the Terms of Use an Authorized User will execute or this Privacy Policy in any way without advance notice to the Applicable Authority. Your continued use of the Services after we make changes is deemed to be acceptance of those changes, so please check with your Applicable Authority and review this Privacy Policy periodically for updates.
Important Notice for Restricted Individuals as Authorized Users Given Access Through an Applicable Authority

The APDS Technology Suite products and services that comprise the Services provide a proprietary suite of correctional technology solutions designed to improve safety for corrections personnel and Restricted Individuals, while also contributing to better Restricted Individual outcomes by facilitating the delivery of digital curricula, programs and services via its proprietary technology. APDS’ Website platform is designed specifically to meet the needs of Restricted Individuals and as such the Services are used by many corrections systems and corrections-affiliated educational organizations throughout the United States. If you are an Authorized User who was given access to the Services by the prison, jail, corrections educational institution or other law enforcement or Applicable Authority in whose custody or control you have been placed, this Privacy Policy does not govern your Applicable Authority’s collection, use, or disclosure of Data through the Website or Services. We are not responsible for your Applicable Authority’s collection, use, or disclosure of your Data. Please contact your Applicable Authority to better understand their privacy practices.

APDS does, however, serve as a repository to retain Data we process on behalf of the Applicable Authority for as long as needed to provide the Services, and we may disclose such Data if we believe such disclosure is necessary to (a) comply with laws or to respond to lawful requests and legal process; or (b) resolve disputes or protect or defend the rights, safety, or property of APDS, Users of our Services, or any person, including to enforce our agreements, policies, and the Terms of Use, or (c) in an emergency to protect the personal safety of any person (collectively, “a”, “b” and “c”, “

APDS may use de-identified Data for product development, research, or other purposes. De-identified Data will have all direct and indirect personal identifiers removed. This includes, but is not limited to, name, ID numbers, date of birth, demographic information, location information, and Applicable Authority ID. Furthermore, APDS agrees not to attempt to re-identify de-identified Data and not to transfer de-identified Data to any party unless that party agrees not to attempt re-identification. APDS uses only de-identified and aggregated data for its own purposes and APDS will not use any Data it collects to advertise or market third-party products or services directly to Restricted Individuals, or their parents if the Restricted Individuals are Juveniles involved as students in educational programs provided through the Services, and does not sell or share for marketing purposes without the consent of the Applicable Authority any of the Data it collects other than on a de-identified aggregate basis to show outcomes of educational programs used for the Services and the benefits of the Services to other correctional institutions similar to a Facility under the control of the Applicable Authority.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, access to identifiable Data may be provided to program staff designated by the Applicable Authority to assist in providing educational and therapeutic services to Restricted Individuals. In addition, APDS may use identifiable Data to support its efforts to track the efficacy of programs provided as part of the Services. APDS is prohibited from mining Data for any purposes other than those agreed to by APDS and the Applicable Authority. Data may not be used for any purpose other than the specific purpose(s) outlined in this Privacy Policy.
Data We Collect About You and How We Collect It
We collect or may receive from the Authorities Data about Authorized Users of our Services or the Website(s), including Data:

• by which you may be personally identified, known generally as personal information or PI or as included within our definition here as Data, such as name, date of birth or social security number, postal address, email address or telephone number to the extent applicable;

by which you may be personally identified, known generally as personal information or PI or as included within our definition here as Data, such as name, date of birth or social security number, postal address, email address or telephone number to the extent applicable;
• that is about you but individually does not identify you, such as the date and duration of a User’s access to the Services, or that relates to a contribution of User-generated Content; and/or
that is about you but individually does not identify you, such as the date and duration of a User’s access to the Services, or that relates to a contribution of User-generated Content; and/or
• about your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Services or a Website and usage details.
about your internet connection, the equipment you use to access our Services or a Website and usage details.
• Directly from you when you provide it to us, for example, upon registration for an Authorized User Account.
Directly from you when you provide it to us, for example, upon registration for an Authorized User Account.

• Automatically as you navigate through the Services. Data collected automatically may include usage details, IP addresses and information collected through cookies, web beacons and other tracking technologies.

Automatically as you navigate through the Services. Data collected automatically may include usage details, IP addresses and information collected through cookies, web beacons and other tracking technologies.
• From third parties, for example, any APDS approved facility, Applicable Authority, corrections educational institution, or other technical support, training and software development partners.
From third parties, for example, any APDS approved facility, Applicable Authority, corrections educational institution, or other technical support, training and software development partners.
The Data we collect on or through our Services or on the Website may include:

• Data that you provide by filling in forms at the Website or through any of our Software downloaded from or used to access our Services. This may include subscribing to a third-party content or education software service provider (“Subscription”) through your Authorized User account for our Services and any Data you submit by uploading or using any software tools or content we provide for you to develop your educational or job placement skills or otherwise access under such Subscription through the Services. This Data submitted for Subscriptions may also include text, photos, graphics, audio files, videos, digital media, likes or other information as content you voluntarily produce, and by submitting such User-generated Content through our Services you agree and consent to the use of your name, face, voice, photograph, video of your likeness (collectively, your “Persona”), and grant APDS a perpetual, royalty-free, worldwide, irrevocable license to use your Persona and any User-generated Content on the Website, as well as any user profile or public information relating to your account, subscribing to any Subscriptions provided through the Services, or requesting further services. For example, our services require you to sign up for an APDS Authorized User account and/or to update your Authorized User account. When you do, we may ask for PI, like your name, email address, telephone number, or Facility identification information. We might also ask you to consent to the creation of an Authorized User profile visible only to our employees and affiliates for security purposes, which may include your name and login credentials and possibly a photo. We may use facial recognition software to use your image to verify your identity prior to accessing the Services. We may also ask you for PI when you take skills assessment tests, educational placement tests or academic achievement tests, undergo or receive progress reports for your use of the Services for educational purposes, or when you report a problem with our support team for our Services.

Data that you provide by filling in forms at the Website or through any of our Software downloaded from or used to access our Services. This may include subscribing to a third-party content or education software service provider (“

”) through your Authorized User account for our Services and any Data you submit by uploading or using any software tools or content we provide for you to develop your educational or job placement skills or otherwise access under such Subscription through the Services. ”), and grant APDS a perpetual, royalty-free, worldwide, irrevocable license to use your Persona and any User-generated Content on the Website, as well as any user profile or public information relating to your account, subscribing to any Subscriptions provided through the Services, or requesting further services. For example, our services require you to sign up for an APDS Authorized User account and/or to update your Authorized User account. • Records and copies of your correspondence (including email addresses) if you contact us. When you contact APDS, we may keep a record of your communication to help solve any issues you might be facing. We may use your email address if you are an Authorized User employed by the Facility or Applicable Authority to which an email address has been provided, or other communications contact information provided to reach an Authorized User who is a Restricted Individual to inform you about our Services, such as letting you know about upcoming changes or improvements.

Records and copies of your correspondence (including email addresses) if you contact us. When you contact APDS, we may keep a record of your communication to help solve any issues you might be facing. We may use your email address if you are an Authorized User employed by the Facility or Applicable Authority to which an email address has been provided, or other communications contact information provided to reach an Authorized User who is a Restricted Individual to inform you about our Services, such as letting you know about upcoming changes or improvements.
• Your responses to surveys that we might ask you to complete for marketing or educational research purposes.
Your responses to surveys that we might ask you to complete for marketing or educational research purposes.

• Details of ownership or attribution for any User-generated Content, creative works or productions or to the extent we choose to offer products or services for sale through our Services or Website, any authorized financial transactions (for example, for applications involving the purchase of items from the Facility commissary or other Facility-distributed products of educational supplies or sundries) you carry out through our Services or a Website and provided in the fulfillment of your Subscriptions or educational progress records.

Details of ownership or attribution for any User-generated Content, creative works or productions or to the extent we choose to offer products or services for sale through our Services or Website, any authorized financial transactions (for example, for applications involving the purchase of items from the Facility commissary or other Facility-distributed products of educational supplies or sundries) you carry out through our Services or a Website and provided in the fulfillment of your Subscriptions or educational progress records.
• Your search queries within the Services or the Website.
Your search queries within the Services or the Website.

• From texted messages or access through the use of a secured mobile computing device such as a tablet or other portable computing device, we also may be provided and collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information including phone number). This mobile device identifier information includes information such as the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI), its Wi-Fi radio (Media Access Control (MAC)) address and/or platform-specific identifiers such as Apple’s Advertiser ID (IDFA). Depending on the settings you have made on your mobile device, APDS may be able to associate your device identifiers or phone number with your Authorized User registration or Authorized User account number.

From texted messages or access through the use of a secured mobile computing device such as a tablet or other portable computing device, we also may be provided and collect device-specific information (such as your hardware model, operating system version, unique device identifiers, and mobile network information including phone number). This mobile device identifier information includes information such as the International Mobile Equipment Identity (IMEI), its Wi-Fi radio (Media Access Control (MAC)) address and/or platform-specific identifiers such as Apple’s Advertiser ID (IDFA). Depending on the settings you have made on your mobile device, APDS may be able to associate your device identifiers or phone number with your Authorized User registration or Authorized User account number.

You may contribute content such as PI that identifies you, including text, photos, graphics, audio files, videos, digital media, likes or other information as content you voluntarily produce to be published or displayed (hereinafter, “
”) through our Services or on any common or public areas of the Website(s), or transmitted to other users of the Services, Website(s) or third parties (collectively, “

”). Your User-generated Content is Posted and transmitted to others at your own risk. Although we limit access to certain pages on the Website(s) and our Services, please be aware that no security measures are perfect or impenetrable. Additionally, we cannot control the actions of other users of our Services or the Website with whom you may choose to share your User-generated Content. Therefore, we cannot and do not guarantee that your User-generated Content will not be accessed or viewed by unauthorized persons.
Usage Details, IP Addresses, Cookies and Other Technologies
As you navigate through and interact with our Services and the Website(s), we may automatically collect certain information about your equipment, browsing actions and patterns, including:
• Details of your use of our Services and visits to the Website(s), including traffic data, logs and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Website.
Details of your use of our Services and visits to the Website(s), including traffic data, logs and other communication data and the resources that you access and use on the Website.
• Information about your computer and internet connection, including your IP address, operating system and browser type.
Information about your computer and internet connection, including your IP address, operating system and browser type.
The Data we collect automatically is statistical data and does not identify any individual. It helps us to improve our Services and to deliver better and more personalized Services by enabling us to:
• Estimate our audience size and usage patterns.
Estimate our audience size and usage patterns.
• Store Data about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Services and Website according to your individual interests.
Store Data about your preferences, allowing us to customize our Services and Website according to your individual interests.
• Recognize you when you return to our Services and the Website(s).
Recognize you when you return to our Services and the Website(s).
The technologies we use for this automatic data collection may include:
• Mobile Device Identifier’s. International Mobile Station Equipment Identity (IMEI),
• Address and/or platform specific identifiers. Apple’s Advertiser ID (IDFA)

• Cookies (or browser cookies). Certain features of the Website(s) may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store Data about your preferences and navigation to, from and on the Website(s). Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies.

Certain features of the Website(s) may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store Data about your preferences and navigation to, from and on the Website(s). Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies.

• Flash Cookies. Certain features of the Website(s) may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store Data about your preferences and navigation to, from and on the Website(s). Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies.

Certain features of the Website(s) may use local stored objects (or Flash cookies) to collect and store Data about your preferences and navigation to, from and on the Website(s). Flash cookies are not managed by the same browser settings as are used for browser cookies.

• Web Beacons. Pages of our Website(s) may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs. pixel tags and single-pixel gifs) that permit APDS, for example, to count users who have visited those pages and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of certain website content and verifying system and server integrity).

Pages of our Website(s) may contain small electronic files known as web beacons (also referred to as clear gifs. pixel tags and single-pixel gifs) that permit APDS, for example, to count users who have visited those pages and for other related website statistics (for example, recording the popularity of certain website content and verifying system and server integrity).
We use Data that we collect about you or that you provide to us, including any personal information:
• To present our Services and the Website(s) and their content to you.
To present our Services and the Website(s) and their content to you.
• To provide you with information, products or services that you request from us.
To provide you with information, products or services that you request from us.
• To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
To fulfill any other purpose for which you provide it.
• To provide you with notices about your APDS Authorized User registration or Authorized User account.
To provide you with notices about your APDS Authorized User registration or Authorized User account.

• To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including, to the extent purchases or financial transactions are involved, for billing and collection.

To carry out our obligations and enforce our rights arising from any contracts entered into between you and us, including, to the extent purchases or financial transactions are involved, for billing and collection.
• To notify you about changes to our Services or Website or any products or services we offer or provide through them.
To notify you about changes to our Services or Website or any products or services we offer or provide through them.
• To allow you to participate in interactive features in our Services or on the Website(s).
To allow you to participate in interactive features in our Services or on the Website(s).
• To allow you to participate in secured mobile computing device applications for our Services or linked to interactive features on the Website(s).
To allow you to participate in secured mobile computing device applications for our Services or linked to interactive features on the Website(s).
• In any other way we may describe when you provide the Data.
In any other way we may describe when you provide the Data.
• For any other purpose with your consent.
For any other purpose with your consent.

• To provide APDS and your Applicable Authority or any other Applicable Authority approved by or under contract with APDS Data on the Authorized Users who have requested information about their Applicable Authority, or any other Applicable Authority approved by or under contract with APDS.

To provide APDS and your Applicable Authority or any other Applicable Authority approved by or under contract with APDS Data on the Authorized Users who have requested information about their Applicable Authority, or any other Applicable Authority approved by or under contract with APDS.
• To detect fraud and to make sure what you have told us is correct.
To detect fraud and to make sure what you have told us is correct.
We may disclose aggregated information about our users, and information that does not identify any individual, without restriction.
We may disclose Data that we collect, or you provide as described in this Privacy Policy:
• To our authorized sponsors, partners and affiliates.
To our authorized sponsors, partners and affiliates.

• To subcontractors, service providers and other third parties we use to support our Services or the Website(s) and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep personally identifiable Data confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them. APDS may rely on one or more subcontractors to perform Services and all subcontractors and their successor entities will be subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy. All subcontractors and successor entities of APDS will be subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

To subcontractors, service providers and other third parties we use to support our Services or the Website(s) and who are bound by contractual obligations to keep personally identifiable Data confidential and use it only for the purposes for which we disclose it to them. APDS may rely on one or more subcontractors to perform Services and all subcontractors and their successor entities will be subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy. All subcontractors and successor entities of APDS will be subject to the terms of this Privacy Policy.

• To a purchaser or other successor in the event of a merger, divestiture, restructuring, reorganization, dissolution or other sale or transfer of some or all of APDS’ assets, whether as a going concern or as part of bankruptcy, liquidation or similar proceeding, in which personal information held by APDS about Authorized Users of our Services or the Website(s) is among the assets transferred.

• To third parties to market their products or services to you if you have consented to these disclosures, including APDS’ contracted third-party information transmitters and third-party electronic payment processing provider(s), if any.

• To fulfill the purpose for which you provide it.
To fulfill the purpose for which you provide it.
• For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the Data.
For any other purpose disclosed by us when you provide the Data.
We may also disclose your personally identifiable information:
• To comply with any court order, law or legal process, including responding to the Authorities, the Applicable Authority or any government or regulatory request.
To comply with any court order, law or legal process, including responding to the Authorities, the Applicable Authority or any government or regulatory request.
• To enforce or apply our Terms of Use and other agreements, including for billing and collection purposes.
To enforce or apply our Terms of Use and other agreements, including for billing and collection purposes.

• If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of APDS, our Authorized Users or partners, sponsors or others. This includes exchanging Data with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection.

If we believe disclosure is necessary or appropriate to protect the rights, property, or safety of APDS, our Authorized Users or partners, sponsors or others. This includes exchanging Data with other companies and organizations for the purposes of fraud protection.
Choices about How We Use and Disclose Your Data
You may be provided with certain mechanisms to provide you with the following control over your Data:

• Mobile Device Tracking Technologies and Geolocation Data.  Your mobile device may have certain settings that relate to the Applications Programming Interface or “API” that allows mobile applications or “apps” to access standard categories of content on a mobile device, but also sensitive content such as geolocation information. It is suggested by organizations responsible for the protection of consumer privacy interests, such as the Federal Trade Commission (“FTC”) that consumers should familiarize themselves with the privacy setting options available on their mobile devices to determine what information may be collected or tracked by certain applications and what steps can be taken to control that access, collection or tracking. Pursuant to our agreement with the Applicable Authority, due to the correctional institution environment in which the Services are used, each APDS provided device issued to a Restricted Individual has been locked and access to such privacy settings and related operating functions disabled. No Authorized User is permitted to access, alter, reverse engineer, hack or change any settings for privacy, access, collection, tracking, communications, or other functions related to the operation of the Services. Any violation of the preceding sentence shall be grounds for immediate termination of your Authorized User Account by APDS or the Applicable Authority. Any questions regarding these matters should be made to your Applicable Authority to review the type of data collected by our Services, to be forwarded to APDS by the Applicable Authority if the Applicable Authority determines the question relevant to a Restricted Individual’s use of the Services as an Authorized User. For further information about these privacy settings or on data collected specific to Mobile Applications used for our Services as provided in this Privacy Policy, please have your Applicable Authority contact us at: privacysupport@apdscorporate.com
Mobile Device Tracking Technologies and Geolocation Data.

Your mobile device may have certain settings that relate to the Applications Programming Interface or “API” that allows mobile applications or “apps” to access standard categories of content on a mobile device, but also sensitive content such as geolocation information. It is suggested by organizations responsible for the protection of consumer privacy interests, such as the Federal Trade Commission (“FTC”) that consumers should familiarize themselves with the privacy setting options available on their mobile devices to determine what information may be collected or tracked by certain applications and what steps can be taken to control that access, collection or tracking. Pursuant to our agreement with the Applicable Authority, due to the correctional institution environment in which the Services are used, each APDS provided device issued to a Restricted Individual has been locked and access to such privacy settings and related operating functions disabled.

No Authorized User is permitted to access, alter, reverse engineer, hack or change any settings for privacy, access, collection, tracking, communications, or other functions related to the operation of the Services. Any violation of the preceding sentence shall be grounds for immediate termination of your Authorized User Account by APDS or the Applicable Authority.

Any questions regarding these matters should be made to your Applicable Authority to review the type of data collected by our Services, to be forwarded to APDS by the Applicable Authority if the Applicable Authority determines the question relevant to a Restricted Individual’s use of the Services as an Authorized User. For further information about these privacy settings or on data collected specific to Mobile Applications used for our Services as provided in this Privacy Policy, please have your Applicable Authority contact us at:

• Tracking Technologies and Advertising. Authorized Users who are Restricted Individuals are subject to monitoring of their use of the Services, including but not limited to, the browser on the device they use to access the Services, including browser cookies, and such tracking technologies as may be required by the Applicable Authority and to the extent authorized by the Applicable Authority, any such tracking technologies cannot be disabled or refused by an Authorized User during their use of the Services. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of the Services may then be inaccessible or not function properly, and for Restricted Individuals such action may be grounds for termination of your Authorized User Account.

Authorized Users who are Restricted Individuals are subject to monitoring of their use of the Services, including but not limited to, the browser on the device they use to access the Services, including browser cookies, and such tracking technologies as may be required by the Applicable Authority and to the extent authorized by the Applicable Authority, any such tracking technologies cannot be disabled or refused by an Authorized User during their use of the Services. If you disable or refuse cookies, please note that some parts of the Services may then be inaccessible or not function properly, and for Restricted Individuals such action may be grounds for termination of your Authorized User Account.

• Administrative and Promotional Announcements from APDS. You acknowledge and agree that the Services may include communications from APDS including, but not limited to, administrative messages and service announcements. You enable these communications upon your registration for your Authorized User Account for the Services, and you are not permitted to opt out of receiving them while you have a registered Authorized User Account on the Services. From time to time, we may send you special offers or other marketing communications about our services, or those of our partners. You may opt out of these messages.
Administrative and Promotional Announcements from APDS.

You acknowledge and agree that the Services may include communications from APDS including, but not limited to, administrative messages and service announcements. You enable these communications upon your registration for your Authorized User Account for the Services, and you are not permitted to opt out of receiving them while you have a registered Authorized User Account on the Services. From time to time, we may send you special offers or other marketing communications about our services, or those of our partners. You may opt out of these messages.

• Accessing and Correcting Your Data Restricted Individuals can review and change their personal information only with the written approval and consent of the Applicable Authority in accordance with the provisions below under the heading Changes to Data. Family members of Restricted Individuals may also require such consent to modify their personal information. You warrant and represent that all Data provided by you within the Services is accurate, complete, and current. You are responsible for maintaining and updating your Authorized User Account Data with your Applicable Authority and APDS to ensure that all Data remains accurate, current and complete. If you provide Data that is not accurate, current or complete, or if APDS has reason to believe that Data you provided is not accurate, current or complete, APDS has the right to suspend or terminate your Authorized User Account and reject any and all future use of the Services by you.

• Changes to Data If you have an Authorized User Account, unless you are an administrative Authorized User, you may only change the personal Data in your account with the written approval and consent of the Applicable Authority which approved your original registration for your Authorized User Account. Upon providing APDS with verification of such approval to the satisfaction of APDS in its sole discretion, you may make such changes by logging into our Services and following the specified procedures. You may also contact your Applicable Authority to ask them to discuss with us any request you may have so long as you remain an Authorized User to request access to, correct or delete any PI that you have provided to us. We will respond to the Applicable Authority about your request, when permitted by law, within 30 days. We cannot delete your personal information except by also deleting your Authorized User Account, with the consent and approval of the Applicable Authority responsible for providing approval for your Authorized User Account. We may not accommodate a request to change any Authorized User profile or Authorized User account data if we believe the change would violate any law or legal requirement or cause the Data to be incorrect. APDS will ensure that all Data in its possession and in the possession of any subcontractors or agents to which APDS may have transferred Data are destroyed or transferred to the Applicable Authority under the direction of the Applicable Authority when the Data are no longer needed for their specified purpose, at the request of the Applicable Authority. If you delete your User-generated Content from our Services or Website, copies of your User-generated Content may remain viewable in cached and archived pages or might have been copied or stored by other users of our Services or a Website. We will retain your Data for as long as your Authorized User Account is active or as needed to provide you our Services. Also, we will retain and use your Data as necessary to comply with our legal obligations, resolve disputes, and enforce our agreements. We may be unable to delete Data that resides in our archives. Proper access and use of Data provided through our Services or on a Website, including User-generated Content, is governed by the terms and conditions set forth in the Terms of Use, the DMCA Copyright Notice, and all attachments, exhibits or amendments.

• Surveys Subject to the approval of the Applicable Authority, you may be asked from time to time to complete a survey related to the Services (each a “Survey”). When you respond to a Survey, we may collect information from you. When you respond to a Survey you grant us permission to transfer and store your Survey responses. Such responses may be shared with the Applicable Authority and other service providers of the Applicable Authority.

Subject to the approval of the Applicable Authority, you may be asked from time to time to complete a survey related to the Services (each a “Survey”). When you respond to a Survey, we may collect information from you. When you respond to a Survey you grant us permission to transfer and store your Survey responses. Such responses may be shared with the Applicable Authority and other service providers of the Applicable Authority.

APDS will store and process Data in accordance with industry best practices. This includes appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to secure Data from unauthorized access, disclosure, and use. We have implemented such measures designed to secure Data, including any PI, from accidental loss and from unauthorized access, use, alteration and disclosure. All Data you provide to us is stored on our secure servers behind firewalls. APDS will conduct periodic risk assessments and remediate any identified security vulnerabilities in a timely manner. APDS will also have a written incident response plan, to include prompt notification of the Applicable Authority in the event of a security or privacy incident, as well as best practices for responding to a breach of PI. APDS agrees to share its incident response plan upon request with the Applicable Authority.
The safety and security of your Data also depends on you.

YOU ARE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL ACTIVITY ASSOCIATED WITH ANY ACCOUNT LOGIN AND PASSWORD YOU MAINTAIN, INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, ONLINE CONDUCT, USE OF THE SERVICES, AND CONSEQUENCES OF MISUSE OF THE SERVICES. YOU ARE SOLELY RESPONSIBLE FOR MAINTAINING THE CONFIDENTIALITY OF YOUR ACCOUNT LOGIN AND PASSWORD. YOU ARE REQUIRED TO NOTIFY APDS OR THE RELEVANT AUTHORITY IMMEDIATELY OF ANY UNAUTHORIZED USE OF YOUR ACCOUNT LOGIN AND PASSWORD

Unfortunately, the transmission of Data via the Internet is not completely secure. Although we do our best to protect your personal information, we cannot guarantee the security of your personal information transmitted through our Services or to the Website(s). Any transmission of personal information is at your own risk. We are not responsible for circumvention of any privacy settings or security measures contained in our Services or on the Website(s).

It is our policy to post any changes we make to our Privacy Policy on this page. The date the Privacy Policy was last revised is identified at the top of the web page on which this Privacy Policy is posted and displayed. You are responsible for ensuring we have an up-to-date active and deliverable contact information as provided through your Applicable Authority if you are an Authorized User who is a Restricted Individual or via an email address if you are an Authorized User who is employed by or under contract as correctional personnel with a Facility or Applicable Authority or other verifiable contact information for you as required and provided by your Facility or Applicable Authority, and for periodically visiting our link to this Privacy Policy in our Services, or the privacy policy link on the Website(s) to review this Privacy Policy to check for any changes.
To ask questions or comment about this privacy policy and our privacy practices, ask your Applicable Authority to contact us at:
or by mail at APDS, 65 West 36th Street, 2nd Floor, New York, NY 10018.

This Privacy Notice for California Residents supplements the information contained in APDS’ general Privacy Policy and applies solely to all Users of our Services who reside in the State of California, in addition to the terms of the general Privacy Policy. We adopt this notice to comply with the California Consumer Privacy Act of 2018 (CCPA) and the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020 (CPRA). Any terms defined in the CCPA and CPRA have the same meaning when used in this notice.

We collect information that identifies, relates to, describes, references, is reasonably capable of being associated with, or could reasonably be linked, directly or indirectly, with a particular consumer, household, or device (“
• Publicly available information from government records.
Publicly available information from government records.
In particular, we have collected through our Services the following categories of PI from consumers within the last twelve (12) months:

A real name, alias, postal address, unique personal identifier, online identifier, Internet Protocol address, email address, account name, Social Security number, driver’s license number, passport number, or other similar identifiers.
B. Personal information categories listed in the California Customer Records statute (Cal. Civ. Code § 1798.80(e)).

A name, signature, Social Security number, physical characteristics or description, address, telephone number, passport number, driver’s license or state identification card number, insurance policy number, education, employment, employment history, bank account number, credit card number, debit card number, or any other financial information, medical information, or health insurance information. Some personal information included in this category may overlap with other categories.
C. Protected classification characteristics under California or federal law.

Age (40 years or older), race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, religion or creed, marital status, medical condition, physical or mental disability, sex (including gender, gender identity, gender expression, pregnancy or childbirth and related medical conditions), sexual orientation, veteran or military status, genetic information (including familial genetic information).
Records of personal property, products or services purchased, obtained, or considered, or other purchasing or consuming histories or tendencies.

Genetic, physiological, behavioral, and biological characteristics, or activity patterns used to extract a template or other identifier or identifying information, such as fingerprints, faceprints, and voiceprints, iris or retina scans, keystroke, gait, or other physical patterns, and sleep, health, or exercise data.
F. Internet or other similar network activity.
Browsing history, search history, information on a consumer’s interaction with a website, application, or advertisement.
Audio, electronic, visual, thermal, olfactory, or similar information.
Current or past job history or performance evaluations.
J. Non-public education information (per the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (20 U.S.C. Section 1232g, 34 C.F.R. Part 99)).

Education records directly related to a student maintained by an educational institution or party acting on its behalf, such as grades, transcripts, class lists, student schedules, student identification codes, student financial information, or student disciplinary records.
K. Inferences drawn from other personal information.
Profile reflecting a person’s preferences, characteristics, psychological trends, predispositions, behavior, attitudes, intelligence, abilities, and aptitudes.

The CCPA and CPRA provide consumers (California residents) with specific rights regarding their personal information. This section describes your CCPA/CPRA rights and explains how to exercise those rights.
Access to Specific Information and Data Portability Rights

You have the right to request that we disclose certain information to you about our collection and use of your personal information over the past 12 months, subject to certain exceptions. Once we receive and confirm your verifiable consumer request (see Exercising Access, Data Portability, and Deletion Rights below), we will disclose to you:
• The categories of personal information we collected about you.
The categories of personal information we collected about you.
• The categories of sources for the personal information we collected about you.
The categories of sources for the personal information we collected about you.
• Our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that personal information.
Our business or commercial purpose for collecting or selling that personal information.
• The categories of third parties with whom we share that personal information.
The categories of third parties with whom we share that personal information.
• Upon request, the specific pieces of personal information we collected about you (also called a data portability request).
Upon request, the specific pieces of personal information we collected about you (also called a data portability request).

• If we disclosed your personal information for a business purpose, a list disclosing: ◦ disclosures for a business purpose, identifying the personal information categories that each category of recipient obtained.
If we disclosed your personal information for a business purpose, a list disclosing:
◦ disclosures for a business purpose, identifying the personal information categories that each category of recipient obtained.
disclosures for a business purpose, identifying the personal information categories that each category of recipient obtained.

Subject to Applicable Authority requirements and other exceptions under the law, you have the right to request that we delete any of your personal information that we collected from you and retained. Once we receive and confirm your verifiable consumer request (see Exercising Access, Data Portability, and Deletion Rights below), we will delete (and direct our service providers to delete) your personal information from our records, unless an exception applies.
We may deny your deletion request if retaining the information is necessary for us or our service provider(s) to:

1. Complete the transaction for which we collected the personal information, provide a good or service that you requested, take actions reasonably anticipated within the context of our ongoing business relationship with you, fulfill the terms of a written warranty or product recall conducted in accordance with federal law, or otherwise perform our contract with you.

Complete the transaction for which we collected the personal information, provide a good or service that you requested, take actions reasonably anticipated within the context of our ongoing business relationship with you, fulfill the terms of a written warranty or product recall conducted in accordance with federal law, or otherwise perform our contract with you.
2. Detect security incidents, protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, or prosecute those responsible for such activities.
Detect security incidents, protect against malicious, deceptive, fraudulent, or illegal activity, or prosecute those responsible for such activities.
3. Debug products to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality.
Debug products to identify and repair errors that impair existing intended functionality.
4. Exercise free speech, ensure the right of another consumer to exercise their free speech rights, or exercise another right provided for by law.
Exercise free speech, ensure the right of another consumer to exercise their free speech rights, or exercise another right provided for by law.
5. Comply with the California Electronic Communications Privacy Act (Cal. Penal Code § 1546 et seq.).
Comply with the California Electronic Communications Privacy Act (Cal. Penal Code § 1546 et seq.).

6. Engage in public or peer-reviewed scientific, historical, or statistical research in the public interest that adheres to all other applicable ethics and privacy laws, when the information’s deletion may likely render impossible or seriously impair the research’s achievement, if you previously provided informed consent.

Engage in public or peer-reviewed scientific, historical, or statistical research in the public interest that adheres to all other applicable ethics and privacy laws, when the information’s deletion may likely render impossible or seriously impair the research’s achievement, if you previously provided informed consent.
7. Enable solely internal uses that are reasonably aligned with consumer expectations based on your relationship with us.
Enable solely internal uses that are reasonably aligned with consumer expectations based on your relationship with us.
8. Comply with a legal obligation or Applicable Authority requirements.
Comply with a legal obligation or Applicable Authority requirements.
9. Make other internal and lawful uses of that information that are compatible with the context in which you provided it.
Make other internal and lawful uses of that information that are compatible with the context in which you provided it.
Exercising Access, Data Portability, and Deletion Rights
To exercise the access, data portability, and deletion rights described above, please submit a verifiable consumer request to us

Only you, or someone legally authorized to act on your behalf, may make a verifiable consumer request related to your PI. You may also make a verifiable consumer request on behalf of your minor child, although we do not intend to make the Services available to any child under the age of 13.
You may only make a verifiable consumer request for access or data portability twice within a 12-month period.
We will only use personal information provided in a verifiable consumer request to verify the requestor’s identity or authority to make the request.
We will not discriminate against you for exercising any of your CCPA/CPRA rights. Unless permitted by the CCPA or CPRA, we will not do any of the following based on your exercise of CCPA/CPRA rights:
• Charge you different prices or rates for services.
Charge you different prices or rates for services.
• Provide you a different level or quality of services.
Provide you a different level or quality of services.
We do not track users over time and across our Services; therefore, we do not respond to Do Not Track signals.

Please read this policy carefully to understand the nature of the biometric information which may be collected or transmitted through APDS’ technology, as well as the retention and destruction practices of APDS.

For purposes of this Biometric Information Privacy Policy, “Biometric Data” means any individual’s biometric identifier and/or information based on an individual’s biometric identifier used to identify that person, regardless of how it is captured, converted, stored or shared. A biometric identifier can include fingerprints, finger scans, voice recognition hand scans or face geometry/scans.

APDS has developed this policy to inform the Users of our Services of the nature of the potential Biometric Data that it may collect, receive, use, store, capture or otherwise obtain, as well as the purpose for which the information is obtained and the retention and destruction procedures in place for Biometric Data. APDS’ technology may collect, receive, obtain, store and use an image of an individual’s hand, finger, face or voice or data derived or extracted from a mathematical formula/algorithm from such image, specifically the use of facial recognition to log into our Learner Portal. Though it may or may not be subject to the Illinois Biometric Information Privacy Act (“BIPA”), 740 ILCS 14/1, et seq., APDS nevertheless elects to provide this policy out of an abundance of caution pursuant to and in accordance with Illinois law.

Potential Biometric Data will be transmitted and stored using a reasonable standard of care for APDS’ industry and in a manner that is the same or exceeds the standards used to protect other confidential information held by APDS, including Social Security numbers, protected health information, etc. APDS will delete or destroy potential Biometric Data every ninety (90) days.

APDS will not sell, lease, trade, or otherwise profit from an individual’s Biometric Data. The potential Biometric Data that could be collected, received, used, stored, captured or otherwise obtained through the APDS system would only be shared between the User, APDS, the Applicable Authority, and any third parties with whom APDS contracts for the provision of its services. The potential Biometric Data will not be disclosed by APDS to third parties or other users unrelated to the User unless: (a) consent is obtained; (b) disclosure is required by law; or (c) disclosure is required by subpoena.
APDS reserves the right to amend this Biometric Information Security Policy at any time.
